file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-01-05-07 - COCKPIT SEAT TRACKS - CLEANING/PAINTING

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL COCKPIT SEAT TRACKS - CLEANING/PAINTING EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to clean the tracks of the pilot and copilot seats. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 53-01-05-100-801-A COCKPIT SEAT TRACKS - CLEANING EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 53-01-05 Page 1 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-01-05-100-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. COCKPIT SEAT TRACKS - CLEANING A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to clean the tracks of the pilot and copilot seats. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION TASK 25-11-01-220-001-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Soft lint-free cloth To clean the seat track AR available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MEP 13-073 Rhodiasolve E-23 AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit RH side/Cockpit LH side I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. J. Cleaning of the Pilot and Copilot Seat Tracks SUBTASK 212-002-A (1) Move the pilot and copilot seats to the maximum forward position, to clean the aft region of the seat tracks. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 100-801-A/700 53-01-05 Page 2 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL WARNING: BE CAREFUL WHEN YOU USE SOLVENTS BECAUSE THEY ARE A HEALTH AND FIRE HAZARD. USE SAFETY GOGGLES AND PROTECTIVE CLOTHING. DO NOT BREATHE THE SOLVENT GASES AND WORK IN A WELL VENTILATED AREA. (2) With a cloth moist with RHODIASOLVE, clean the seat track. (3) With a plastic spatula, remove any material that can be in the track holes. Refer to Figure 701. (4) Move the pilot and copilot seats to the maximum aft position, to clean the forward region of seat tracks. Repeat the steps (2) and (3). K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Do a detailed inspection on the pilot and copilot seats to make sure that their locking pins lock in the tracks. Refer to TASK 25-11-01-220-001-A item (2).
